diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Atypical reactive process, T-cell lymphoma, infectious mononucleosis, HIV infection, bacterial infections, Lyme disease, autoimmune conditions including systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis, Sjögren’s syndrome, sarcoidosis, multicentric Castleman’s disease, Kikuchi’s lymphadenitis
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was supported by the patient's clinical presentation of prolonged fever, rash, lymphadenopathy, and splenomegaly, along with biopsy findings that indicated reactive follicular hyperplasia and paracortical expansion with T-cell and polyclonal B-cell populations, while no evidence of other infectious or autoimmune etiologies was found.
